review.rating: 5 star hotel experience without the 5 star hotel price. Absolutely phenomenal in every way.
review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive: The location was phenomenal. I was less than a 5 min walk from Independence Palace, less than 10 min from the post office and other key tourist spots. I was less than 10 min from Diamond shopping center and right outside of the hotel was a cell phone carrier, so I purchased data quickly because I wanted an e-sim and the airport only had physical sims. To the right of the hotel, is a Jolibee and close by are plenty of convenience stores so that you can easily purchase snacks. Breakfast was delicious. It was obviously Vietnamese centered, but they had mini pancakes, cereal, and other Western comforts. I stuck with the Vietnamese foods despite being an American because I have allergies. The breakfast selection was also great because it wasn’t the same every day which I appreciated.
review.comment_negative: I only received one room key. I was traveling solo, and I understand for safety and cost effectiveness, but I wish that I could have charged a few devices while I was sightseeing, but you needed your card to re-enter the room and to use the elevator. I could have left it and then asked them to let me in, but it wasn’t worth it.

review.rating: Comfortable stay with excellent pool and room
review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive: The pool is exactly as advertised and such a delight. Perfect escape from the midday heat. The staff are attentive, polite, and there's always someone's on hand to help you out at any hour of the day. The bed was the most comfortable we had in Vietnam. The bathroom was perfect. Plenty of toiletries, teas and coffees. They provide you with pool towels, bathrobes and Slippers. Rooms were perfectly made every day. Despite central location the room was dead quiet with the windows firmly blocking out all road noise despite facing the street. Within walking distance to several major attractions.

review.rating: Ruhig, ruhig, ruhig ... es war traumhaft
review.room_type: Phòng Premium Deluxe Giường Đôi/2 Giường Đơn Nhìn ra Thành phố
review.comment_positive:
Das Hotelzimmer hatte hervorragende Schallschutzfenster und hat uns damit eine wunderbare Ruheoase in dieser lauten, lebhaften Stadt beschert. Das Frühstück war sehr lecker und reichhaltig. Der Pool zwar klein aber herrlich erfrischend und das Zimmer sehr sauber, zwar klein aber gemütlich. Die Lage war klasse, man konnte alle Sehenswürdigkeiten sehr gut fußläufig erreichen. 
Das Ganze zu einem sehr gutem Preis-Leistungsverhältnis! Fazit: Wenn Saigon, dann diese Unterkunft!!

review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive: The Orchids Saigon was a great place to stay during our visit to Ho Chi Minh City. The room and lobby area were very modern and clean, and the staff was helpful when we asked them for recommendations for sites to visit and services nearby. The hotel is walking distance from several major landmarks or a quick Grab ride. I would recommend Orchids Saigon to any traveler who is looking for a comfortable and convenient place to stay that is great value!

review.rating: Very pleasant hotel at the heart of HCMC
review.room_type: Phòng Superior Giường Đôi/2 Giường Đơn
review.comment_positive:
Very well situated at the heart of Saigon. Walking distance from many landmarks worth visiting such as the Independence Palace, the War Remnants museum and the cathedral Notre Dame de Saigon. 
The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and the bed was really comfortable. We were on the 2nd floor facing the back and had no noise from the street. 
The breakfast buffet was very varied with a great selection of Western and Asian foods. 
Overall, it was a very pleasant hotel to stay in.
review.comment_negative: The pool side bar did not have any drinks or staff to serve them. We had to go down to the bar in the  lobby to get our drinks ourselves and bring them back to the pool on the 9th floor.

review.rating: Pleasant stay ruined by bizarrely poor customer relations
review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive: Clean and comfortable with some pleasant staff and a good location
review.comment_negative: An otherwise positive experience was ruined when I was bizarrely called to the front desk like a naughty child and told there was a stain on my pillowcase (I do not wear make up and was not shown the item) and did I have any suggestions on how to clean it? When I queried how I was to know it was my pillowcase I was shown a blurred photograph and told I would be charged 100 000 dong. The situation was made even more unacceptable by the fact that the senior member of staff on duty had a grubby and blood stained shirt. I asked to see the manager but he was “away on business”. It was not the amount of money but the principle.

review.comment_positive: Très bien situé près du parc du palais de l'indépendance, à 20 mn à pied du marché Ben Tanh  et de l'animation touristique du district 1. Le district 3 est très agréable et on y trouve toutes sortes de restaurants. Nous avons eu un souci de réservation avant notre arrivée car l'enregistrement de ma carte bancaire était refusé alors qu'elle était parfaitement valide tout au long de mon séjour avant et après. Ceci s'est rapidement arrangé à l'accueil. L'hotel lui-même est très agréable, d'un excellent rapport qualité-prix et le personnel dans son ensemble particulièrement accueillant et agréable.

review.rating: Not what we expected, bit of a let down
review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive: Room was clean, although smaller than expected. Check in was quick even though arrived late. Location was good. Close to centre.
review.comment_negative:
Pool area bar was closed permanently, not implied in advert. Gym was literally a bed room with a few weights in it. Breakfast sub par and towards end of breakfast slot felt like staff were trying to push us out. By far the worst was the accusations that a face cloth (!) was missing and the implication that we took it. Clearly had been picked up by accident when towels were collected in room clean. Part way during the stay when we had been at reception staff had almost threatened that if we couldn’t find it by the end of the stay “they would be having words with us.” On check out they held us while they did a room sweep, we had to emphasis we needed to leave for our flight, they then tried to charge us. We offered them to check out bags for said stolen face cloth. Ended up pushing back and effectively had to sign what was a makeshift affidavit saying we didn’t steal it. Really hope
They don’t hold that against cleaning staff and cut their wages for this - which seems likely based on the whole issue. Have since read other reviews saying that other guests were attempted to be charged for stained towels and dirty facecloths - seems bizarre considering the purpose of a face cloth is to clean dirt off your face. Ended up stressing out for most of our stay knowing we had this argument ahead of us with staff - over a face cloth……

Over all put a very sour taste in the mouth. Aircon also wasn’t working the first night so room was roasting. When we went down - another couple were staying the same. To be fair they fixed it quickly - but surely a regular faculties check of air con filters is standard procedure. Disappointing considering we paid extra for hotel for good service and faculties when in reality could have paid for much cheaper.

review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Orchids Hotel during my visit to the city, and I must say it was a truly exceptional experience from start to finish.

From the moment I stepped into the hotel, I was greeted by the warm and welcoming staff, whose friendliness and professionalism stood out throughout my entire stay. They went above and beyond to ensure that I felt comfortable and had everything I needed, making the check-in process seamless and stress-free.

The highlight of my stay was undoubtedly the spacious and impeccably clean room. The attention to detail in maintaining cleanliness was remarkable, and I felt reassured about the hotel's commitment to hygiene, especially in these times. The room was not only large but also thoughtfully designed, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, guaranteeing a restful night's sleep after a day of exploring the city.

One of the hotel's key strengths is its prime location in the city center. Being in the heart of the action allowed me to easily access popular attractions, restaurants, and shopping districts, making my overall experience even more enjoyable. Whether I was attending a business meeting or exploring the city's cultural gems, the hotel's central location was undeniably convenient.

The breakfast offered at the hotel was nothing short of excellent. The diverse spread catered to various tastes and dietary preferences, with fresh and high-quality ingredients. The attentive staff in the dining area ensured that tables were promptly cleared, and they were always ready to assist with any special requests.

In conclusion, my stay exceeded all expectations. The combination of friendly and professional staff, a spacious and clean room, a central location, and a delightful breakfast made it a memorable and enjoyable experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a top-notch accommodation experience in the heart of the city.

Neben dem Hotel ist das lalaLand, ein Restaurant kombiniert mit einer professionellen Musikbühne. https://www.navivu.com/2023/12/lalaland-ho-con-rua-nguyen-thi-minh-khai-quan-1.html?m=1#google_vignette

 Jeden Abend wird es für ein paar Stunden richtig laut. Wenn man den ganzen Tag unterwegs war und einfach Platt ist, ist an schlafen ohne Ohrenstöpsel nicht zu denken. Fit ist man garantiert am nächsten Tag nicht, wenn der Wecker früh geht.

Unfassbar komplizierte Shuttlebuchung: Nicht weil die Mitarbeiter nicht wollen, sondern eher weil das Hotel keinen offiziellen Support bietet. Erbärmlich das Mitarbeiter mit ihren eigenen Handys schreiben und telefonieren und Geld aus eigener Tasche vorstrecken müssen. War mir was unangenehm.
Geschenkt das unser Zimmer am ersten Tag nicht "gemacht" wurde. Kann passieren.
Für den Preis hatte ich mehr erwartet!

review.rating: it's an OK hotel with seemingly no intention to stand out.
review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive: The hotel is well located, within walking distance from everything we wanted to see in Ho Chi Minh city.
review.comment_negative:
The room was a little too small for our taste (I understand paying less gets you less of course). Having spent the last 2 days of our 2-week holiday, we found it's not really possible to really open both our suitcases in the room. What was disappointing is the pool: it is less spacious than in the pictures, but hey, you're in the city center so that's okay. However, there is no one at the pool bar -no music, no service of any kind. When you tell this to the front desk, they say you can order at the bar in the lobby -9 stories below the pool:)

The breakfast was also not something we really liked but to be fair, by this point we wanted to eat western stuff, so the selection of Vietnam breakfast might have been better. The coffee was downright bad though in any standard (even worse knowing how great coffee Vietnam has).

The last and final experience we had was the minibar bill: when paying the bill, it turned out that the amounts in the menu in the room were not inclusive of tax, so whatever you pay is approx. 17% more. This is nothing brutal since there are only soft drinks and water available but for me, it's really about the principle: why would you present the price for food and drinks without tax? This is not at all customary in the country, we have not experienced this anywhere else. Again, it is not about the amount, but the fact that this is literally the last experience you get that will stay with you.

review.comment_positive: L'emplacement est idéal car très proche des principales attractions touristiques de Saigon. Comme le rapport qualité /prix est bon et que nous arrivions à 6h40 le matin par un vol Air France nous avons réservé une chambre dès la veille, si bien qu'en arrivant nous avons pu prendre un petit déjeuner (sur Air France en 12h de vol nous n'avions eu qu'un repas et une collation) et occuper immédiatement nos chambres de telle sorte qu'à 13h00 nous étions en forme pour les visites et nous nous sommes ainsi vite habitués au décalage horaire.
review.comment_negative: La salle à manger pour le petit déjeuner est un peu petite pour le nombre de clients mais le personnel est efficace et prépare immédiatement une table quand elle se libère. Chambre confortable mais un peu "vieillotte" avec vue sur la station service...

review.comment_positive:
The location was good for walking to the Independence Palace, and it is close to Saigon Zoo (great for our 4 year old). The food available in house was good and the breakfast had plenty of options from western (eggs, pancakes, toast) and asian (noodles, salad). The breakfast options changed daily and despite the busy breakfast mornings there was always plenty of food in the buffet. Great restaurant in walking distance, Pizza & Bia. 
Airport transfers are organised by the hotel. The hotel room was lovely and quiet. The staff were very friendly especially to our little one. The swimming pool area had only a few seats but we were never left without at least one being available to us.
review.comment_negative: The towels next to the pool would regularly be gone and not checked on for a while. The bathroom had a window that looked into the bedroom which is not great when you are staying with your family. There was a blind that we could pull down. There was also a full length window next to the toilet which again we kept the blind down for the time we were there.

review.room_type: Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố

review.comment_positive: Property is in a good location with most sights within 15 minute walk and plenty of restaurants nearby.
review.comment_negative:
We deliberately booked a room with a window only to find it looked straight into a next door concrete wall. This was obviously disappointing. We did ask for a move recognising that this might be difficult. but perhaps even more disappointing was the lack of interest of reception staff advising us that we had the type of room we booked so nothing could be done.

It was also disappointing that the cafe/bar in the pool area was closed.

Carpeting needs refurbishment.

Phòng Deluxe Giường Đôi Nhìn Ra Thành Phố
review.comment_positive:
This was the last place we stayed while visiting Vietnam and easily one of the best hotels.
It was extremely clean, rooftop pool was great, very comfortable beds and Netflix on the tv to use. Location is quiet at night time from the 8th floor and beautiful view from the room. Neighborhood is very safe and a short walk to eateries.
On check out we asked to store our stuff all day which was no problem and they even let us use the pool and gym shower on the last day as our flight didn't leave until 11pm.
About 150000 dong from the airport.
review.comment_negative:
The gym wasn't really a gym.
Only a cross trainer and a treadmill with some small weights. 
Our air-conditioning wasn't overly cold even on 16 degrees but we slept through with no problems.
